item.title: India vs Australia 5th Test Day 3 LIVE Score: Krishna derails AUS' momentum with twin strike but IND miss Bumrah - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia 5th Test Day 3 LIVE Score: Prasidh Krishna steps up in Bumrah’s absence with 3 quick AUS wickets

Date: Not specified
Source: Hindustan Times

In a thrilling contest on Day 3 of the 5th Test between India and Australia, Prasidh Krishna made a significant impact with three wickets, helping to derail Australia's momentum in their chase of 162 runs.

  • Prasidh Krishna took three crucial wickets early on, including the wicket of Steve Smith.
  • India set Australia a target of 162 runs after being all out for 157.
  • Scott Boland claimed a 10-wicket haul in the match.
  • Jasprit Bumrah's absence was felt, as fitness concerns arose around his back spasms.
  • The match has seen 26 wickets fall in just two days, indicating a challenging pitch for batting.
“If Jasprit Bumrah is fit then 145-150 might be enough. But if Bumrah is not fit then a score of around 200 also might not be enough.” - Sunil Gavaskar

The match remains pivotal for both teams, with India looking to level the series while Australia aims to maintain their dominance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah's absence forces Mohammed Siraj to open bowling against Australia on Day 3 at SCG - The Times of India
item.description:
Mohammed Siraj Opens Bowling Against Australia as Jasprit Bumrah Misses Day 3

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

India's leading bowler Jasprit Bumrah was unable to play on Day 3 of the fifth Test against Australia due to back spasms, prompting Mohammed Siraj to take over opening duties.

  • Bumrah batted after bowling just one over before leaving the field due to injury.
  • India set Australia a target of 162 runs after being dismissed for 157 in their second innings.
  • Scott Boland achieved figures of 6-45, leading the Australian bowling attack.
  • Rishabh Pant scored a notable 61, becoming the top scorer for India.
  • Australia lead the series 2-1, needing a win or draw to reclaim the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
"If they win or draw, it would also put them into the World Test Championships final in June at Lord's against South Africa."

This match highlights the struggle for India without their star bowler, while Australia aims for a significant series victory.

item.title: Yuzvendra Chahal shares cryptic post amid divorce rumours with Dhanashree Verma - India Today
item.description:
Yuzvendra Chahal's Cryptic Post Fuels Divorce Rumours with Dhanashree Verma

Published On: Jan 4, 2025 | Published By: Diya Kakkar

Indian cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal has sparked speculation about his marriage to Dhanashree Verma with a cryptic Instagram post, amid reports of their potential separation.

  • Chahal shared a cryptic message on Instagram, possibly reflecting on his personal struggles.
  • Reports indicate that Chahal and Dhanashree have unfollowed each other and deleted shared photos, which has intensified divorce speculations.
  • Sources suggest they have been living separately for months and their marriage appears to be crumbling.
  • The couple married in December 2020 after meeting during the pandemic.
“Hard work spotlights the character of people. You know your journey. You know your pain…”

The ongoing silence from both parties regarding the rumors leaves fans uncertain about the future of their relationship.

item.title: ‘I’ve been emphasising over last 8-10 days…’: Gavaskar urges Agarkar to keep options open after Virat Kohli’s horror run - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Gavaskar Advises Agarkar on Kohli's Future Amid Poor Performance

January 04, 2025 - Hindustan Times

Sunil Gavaskar has urged the selection committee to consider the future of Virat Kohli following his disappointing performance during the series against Australia, including identical dismissals throughout the series.

  • Gavaskar highlighted Kohli's poor run, with only one century and an average of 23.75 in nine innings.
  • He emphasized the need for the selection committee to focus on players for the upcoming 2027 World Test Championship final.
  • Kohli displayed a recurring technical flaw, struggling to adjust to deliveries outside the off-stump.
  • If India wins the Sydney Test, they will retain the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
“Ultimately, the selectors, led by Ajit Agarkar, need to look at who will be available for the 2027 final and who will still be selectable.” - Sunil Gavaskar

Gavaskar's remarks underscore the pressure on Kohli to improve as India moves forward in international cricket, especially with future championships in sight.

item.title: Saxophone signed! Joyous Virat Kohli wins fan's heart in Australia - Watch - The Times of India
item.description:
Virat Kohli Charms Fans in Australia with Signed Saxophone

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

Virat Kohli endeared himself to fans once again during his recent interaction in Australia, showcasing his warm personality outside of cricket.

  • Kohli paused to sign a saxophone for a fan as he boarded the team bus.
  • This display of goodwill reflects his popularity and approachability off the field.
  • Despite his kind gesture, Kohli struggled on the cricket field, being dismissed for six runs in the ongoing Test series.
  • India holds a lead in the series after significant contributions from other players.
“Kohli gave the fan a thumbs-up before continuing to the bus.”

His interactions continue to highlight the importance of athlete-fan relationships, even as he faces challenges in his performance.

item.title: "Taken The Pants Of The Aussies": World Cup-Winner's Funny Praise For Rishabh Pant - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"Taken The Pants Of The Aussies": World Cup-Winner's Funny Praise For Rishabh Pant

Published on: January 4, 2025 | Source: NDTV

During the fifth Test against Australia, Rishabh Pant scored a remarkable 61 runs off just 33 balls, leading to humorous praise from former World Cup-winner Krishnamachari Srikkanth.

  • Pant scored the fastest fifty by a visiting batter on Australian soil.
  • He hit six fours and four sixes, showcasing his aggressive batting style.
  • Srikkanth tweeted: "What a knock by Pant! He's just taken the pants off the Aussies!"
  • Pant's rapid fifty came off just 29 balls, outperforming notable historical records.
  • His innings contributed to a partnership with Ravindra Jadeja that helped India surpass 100 runs.
“What a knock by pant! He's just taken the pants of the Aussies! #INDvsAUS” — Kris Srikkanth (@KrisSrikkanth) January 4, 2025

Pant's rapid scoring came at a crucial time as he joined the team batting under pressure, further solidifying his status as one of India’s top batsmen in Test cricket.

item.title: With Jasprit Bumrah watching from on the field and off it, ‘captain’ Virat Kohli calls the shots - The Indian Express
item.description:
Virat Kohli Takes Charge in Jasprit Bumrah's Absence During Match

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Indian Express

In a crucial match, Virat Kohli stepped up significantly after Jasprit Bumrah had to leave the field due to back spasms. His leadership was prominent as he actively engaged in fielding strategies and encouraged his teammates.

  • Kohli's day started with a minor lapse in fielding positions but quickly took charge of the game.
  • In Bumrah's absence, Kohli was very animated and involved, making adjustments and supporting bowlers.
  • He communicated effectively with both bowlers and fielders, helping them settle and perform.
  • His energy was evident as he celebrated milestones with teammates during the match.
  • After batting, Kohli faced disappointment, being dismissed by a delivery reminiscent of his earlier wicket.
“Let them earn it. Let them play some hard-fought cricket for the next few years or whatever it is. Let them earn it,” - Rohit Sharma on captaincy potential within the team.

Kohli's performance, both in the field and with the bat, showcased his experience and leadership, especially when the team faced challenges.

item.title: 'Not His Battle To Fight': Ricky Ponting On Sam Konstas' Heated Exchange With Jasprit Bumrah - News18
item.description:
Ricky Ponting Comments on Sam Konstas' Interjection in Bumrah-Khawaja Clash

Last Updated: January 04, 2025, 21:36 IST

Former Australia skipper Ricky Ponting criticized Sam Konstas for involving himself in a verbal exchange between Jasprit Bumrah and Usman Khawaja during the Sydney Test. Ponting emphasized that it was unnecessary for Konstas to intervene in the matter.

  • Ponting condemned Konstas' actions, stating it was not his place to step in.
  • He hoped for a discussion in the Australian dressing room regarding the incident.
  • Ponting advised against upsetting Bumrah, who has been impactful in the series.
  • He expressed disdain for time-wasting tactics in cricket, suggesting it can backfire.
  • Australia suffered as Bumrah dismissed Khawaja on the last delivery of Day 1.
“I didn’t like Konstas getting involved. That was not his battle to fight.” - Ricky Ponting

The incident highlights the importance of senior players managing their disputes without unnecessary interference from younger players.

item.title: "Cows Could Have...": Sunil Gavaskar Slams SCG Pitch As 15 Wickets Fall On Day 2 Of 5th Test - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Sunil Gavaskar Critiques SCG Pitch as 15 Wickets Fall in Fifth Test

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 Source: NDTV

The ongoing fifth Test at the Sydney Cricket Ground has seen a total of 15 wickets tumble on the second day, prompting legendary cricketer Sunil Gavaskar to voice his concerns about the pitch conditions.

  • After 11 wickets fell on day one, day two resulted in another 15 wickets.
  • India bowled out Australia for 181, taking a four-run first-innings lead.
  • Gavaskar suggests that the pitch conditions would be criticized if they occurred in India.
  • Scott Boland excelled, taking 4 wickets for 42 runs after having taken 4 for 31 on day one.
  • Australia's Alex Carey praised Boland's performance and strategy.
“If 15 wickets fell (on one day) in India, all hell would have broken loose.” - Sunil Gavaskar

In conclusion, this Test match is raising questions about ideal playing conditions and the nature of pitches used in cricket.

item.title: Workload may've affected Jasprit Bumrah but he's not this BGT's top workhorse - The Times of India
item.description:
Workload may've affected Jasprit Bumrah but he's not this BGT's top workhorse

Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

India's ace bowler, Jasprit Bumrah, has garnered attention not just for his performances but also for his workload amid concerns over a potential back spasm. As the Border-Gavaskar Trophy approaches its conclusion, Bumrah's fitness for the crucial matches remains uncertain.

  • Bumrah has taken 31 wickets in just five Tests of the series.
  • Despite his efforts, he is not in the top two for overs bowled this series.
  • Australia's Pat Cummins and Mitchell Starc have bowled more deliveries than Bumrah.
  • In batting contributions, Bumrah has scored 42 runs compared to Cummins' 159 and Starc's 97.
“It remains unclear whether he will take the field tomorrow.”

As discussions swirl around his performance and fitness, the cricketing world anxiously awaits Bumrah's next steps as India strives for victory in the series.

item.title: Virat Kohli's 40-minute nostalgia act amid Bumrah injury scare reprises glory days, shows India what they're missing - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Virat Kohli's 40-minute nostalgia act amid Bumrah injury scare reprises glory days, shows India what they're missing

Publication Date: [Date not provided]   Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses Virat Kohli's impressive leadership during a crucial moment in a Test match when Jasprit Bumrah was sidelined due to injury. Kohli took charge and rallied the team, showcasing his tactical acumen and ability to inspire.

  • Jasprit Bumrah suffered from back spasms, leading to concerns during a Test match.
  • Bumrah was a key player, having taken 31 wickets before the injury occurred.
  • Kohli stepped up in Bumrah's absence, effectively coordinating the bowling attack.
  • The team showcased resilience and impressive catching during the match.
  • Kohli's leadership was highlighted as he guided his teammates through a challenging moment.
“His bat might have been overcome by ice, but the fire in Kohli is still burning bright.”

In conclusion, Virat Kohli's performance highlighted his capabilities as a leader, reminding fans and players of his strategic brilliance and inspirational presence on the cricket field.

item.title: Rickelton 259, Verreynne 100 and Jansen fifty lead SA's domination of Pakistan - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Rickelton's Marathon 259 and Verreynne's Century Dominate Pakistan

Date: Not specified Source: ESPNcricinfo

South Africa's dominance over Pakistan was highlighted by Ryan Rickelton's double century and Kyle Verreynne's century, leaving Pakistan in a precarious position at Newlands.

  • South Africa scored 615 runs, with Rickelton making 259 and Verreynne 100.
  • Pakistan ended day two at 64 for 3, trailing by 551 runs.
  • South African bowlers Kagiso Rabada and Marco Jansen guided South Africa's attack.
  • Rickelton's 259 is the highest score at Newlands since Stephen Fleming's 262.
  • South Africa's score is their highest at home in four years.
“Rickelton became the first South African in eight years to score a Test double hundred.”

The day was a complete nightmare for Pakistan, who faced relentless pressure from a formidable South African side.

item.title: ‘Rishabh Pant has taken the pants off Aussies’: India’s World Cup-winning legend doesn’t hesitate - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kris Srikkanth's Hilarious Take on Rishabh Pant's Impressive Performance in Border-Gavaskar Trophy

Date: Jan 04, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a thrilling match against Australia in the final Border-Gavaskar Trophy Test, Rishabh Pant made headlines with a blistering innings of 61 runs off 33 balls, helping India in their comeback after a rocky start.

  • Rishabh Pant's innings consisted of six fours and four sixes at a strike rate of 184.85.
  • Pant crossed 5,000 international runs during this knock.
  • His performance drew praise on social media, silencing critics after a poor series.
  • India took a narrow lead over Australia after the first innings, with Indian bowlers putting in a solid effort.
  • Kris Srikkanth humorously remarked, “He’s just taken the pants off the Aussies!”
“What a knock by Pant!” - Kris Srikkanth

The match is pivotal in the context of the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy series, with India looking to end the series in a draw with a win in Sydney.

item.title: Pant's blitz and Test cricket on warp-speed at SCG - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Pant's Blitz and Test Cricket on Warp-Speed at SCG

Publication Date: Not provided
Source: Cricbuzz

Rishabh Pant played a remarkable innings against Australia at the SCG, scoring 61 runs off just 33 balls, showcasing a rapid approach to Test cricket on a challenging pitch.

  • Pant's explosive knock highlighted a day of fast-paced Test cricket where over 300 runs were scored.
  • The match saw a total of 15 wickets fall, indicating a day full of action and drama.
  • Virat Kohli faced a disappointing end in his final Test innings on Australian soil.
  • Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammad Siraj were instrumental in bowling early breakthroughs.
Pant was providing a blueprint to every other batter who'd take strike in Sydney for the reminder of the match.

The match showcased the unpredictability of Test cricket, as all outcomes remained possible heading into the climax of the series.

item.title: Watch: Rohit Sharma Silences Retirement Talk, Delivers Mic-Drop Response To Presenter - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Watch: Rohit Sharma Silences Retirement Talk, Delivers Mic-Drop Response To Presenter

Publication Date: January 4, 2025 Source: NDTV Sports

Rohit Sharma's future in Test cricket remains uncertain as he took a self-imposed break from the playing XI. During an interview, he addressed retirement speculations, asserting he is not going anywhere yet.

  • Rohit has opted out of the fifth Test, citing a lack of form.
  • He humorously responded to a presenter’s statement about his captaincy, proclaiming, "I'm not going anywhere yet!".
  • He emphasized the importance of focusing on the present and not predicting the future.
  • Rohit highlighted his long experience in cricket, stating outside opinions won't dictate his decisions.
“At the same time I have to be realistic as well.” - Rohit Sharma

Rohit Sharma indicated he will take time to evaluate his future in Test cricket, with the next series not until June.

item.title: Vinod Kambli hit his wife with a cooking pan in the past and then... - India.com
item.description:
Vinod Kambli's Past Legal Issues with Wife Andrea Hewitt

Date: Not provided, Source: India.com

Vinod Kambli, a former Indian cricketer, faced serious legal troubles after his wife Andrea Hewitt filed an FIR against him with the Bandra Police after a domestic incident involving a cooking pan.

  • The incident occurred when Kambli came home drunk and allegedly hit his wife on the head with a cooking pan.
  • Andrea sought medical treatment for her head injuries before reporting the incident to the police.
  • Kambli was booked under Sections 324 and 504 for causing hurt and insult.
  • The couple's relationship had previously been viewed as one of love overcoming challenges.
Andrea Hewitt mentioned, 'the matter is now getting sorted out.'

The legal issues reflect ongoing struggles in Kambli's personal life, drawing attention to domestic violence issues.

item.title: 'Cannot take us for granted': Prasidh Krishna's fiery 'all eleven of us are here' reminder to Sam Konstas - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Prasidh Krishna's Fiery Reminder to Sam Konstas During Sydney Test

January 04, 2025, HT Sports

The Sydney Test between Australia and India is heading for a thrilling conclusion, with both teams vying for victory. Prasidh Krishna issued a strong statement to Sam Konstas, emphasizing the unity and aggression of the entire Indian team.

  • Prasidh Krishna stated, "If you want to fight, you have to face the whole Indian lineup."
  • India took a narrow lead of 4 runs after bundling Australia out for 181.
  • Rishabh Pant scored 61 runs off 33 balls, significantly contributing to India's extended lead.
  • Jasprit Bumrah left the field due to back spasms on Day 2.
“You cannot take us for granted. We are here, all eleven of us.” - Prasidh Krishna

In conclusion, Krishna's remarks reflect the team spirit and determination of the Indian squad, signaling a fierce competition ahead in the match.
